messages.msgSnippet: The SlightlyCrunchyAP yahoo group is a good one.  And of course the Mothering.com forums. Michelle, SF Bay Area Mommy to the bright-eyed Rory Daniel, 5.3.02

Mothering.com forums.

Michelle, SF Bay Area

My daughter used to hang out at Mango Mama. Now, after a couple of other
stops, she hangs out here:
http://pub3.ezboard.com/bsageparenting
I think her name there is skiesmama.
Tia

messages.subject: RE:Good parenting mommy list
messages.msgSnippet: Teresa, you might want to try www.amitymama.com They have a huge forum about anything under the sun and all AP. Also another REALLY good list I have been on
messages.messageBody:
Teresa, you might want to try www.amitymama.com They have a huge forum
about anything under the sun and all AP. Also another REALLY good list I
have been on for a while is healthyparenting@yahoogroups.com - they are
very AP and very health oriented. I find it a great source of education
about everything. And the ladies are all very nice.

Annette,Jason
& Our 3 Boujas
Nicolas, Joseph
& peanut due 1/12/04

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Good parenting mommy list
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/2/04 2:59:18 PM, ctbucknum@shaw.ca writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/2/04 2:59:18 PM, ctbucknum@... writes:

<< HI I thought I might ask you all if you know of any good on line AP
support groups. >>

There's a Continuum Concept site/forum. Maybe their list?
Maybe check the La Leche League site for their recommendations?

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Good parenting mommy list
messages.msgSnippet: Many AMUers moved to YAAPS (www.yaaps.com).  The feeling at Yaaps, though, is definitely more accepting of a wider variety of parenting than AMU or MM was.
messages.messageBody:
Many AMUers moved to YAAPS (www.yaaps.com). The feeling at Yaaps, though, is definitely more accepting of a wider variety of parenting than AMU or MM was. Another place with a lot of AMUers is www.motherspirit.net. Motherspirit has several public forums, but more private ones - I don't post there so I'm not sure what the overall tone is.

-Cat
----- Original Message -----
From: The Bucknum's
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, January 02, 2004 4:56 PM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Good parenting mommy list


HI I thought I might ask you all if you know of any good on line AP support groups. Years ago I was on Alterna Moms Unite but their forum seems to be gone. Mango Mamas gone too and I would like to find an online hangout for myself somewhere to regroup so to speak. That link to the edgy-catin mamas looked promising for about four or five minutes till I read about how pinning your kid down to brush there teeth was recommended. Anyway thanks for your time
Teresa in Canada
